intro: Veronica rosea, commonly known as the pink speedwell, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems, and it thrives in well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade. Veronica rosea is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and easy care requirements.
